channel.title: Non-Standard PIDs
channel.description:
I'm at a bit of a loss to how I'm suppose to query these pids.
Description Display PID Min Max Scale Unit Equation HV Battery state of charge SoC 224801 0.0 100.0 x1 % ((((A*256)+B)*(1/5))/100) HV Battery temperature HV Temp 224800 0.0 150.0 x1 DegF ((A*18)-580)/100 HV Battery current in Amps HV Amps 22480b -200 200 x1 Amps ((((Signed(A)*256)+B)/5)/10)*-1 HV Battery Voltage HV Volts 22480d 0.0 400.0 x1 Volts (((A*256)+B)/100) Temperature inside car Inside Temp 22dd04 0.0 160.0 x1 DegF ((A*18)-400)/10

item.title: Non-Standard PIDs
item.dc:creator: cyclin_al1
item.description:
Since you have the PIDs and the equations to interpret the data, check out an example on how to do the standard PIDs with the source code for the Code Reader Sample app:

GitHub

GitHub - carloop/app-code-reader: Fault code reader

Fault code reader. Contribute to carloop/app-code-reader development by creating an account on GitHub.

Read full topic

item.title: Non-Standard PIDs
item.dc:creator: Samistine
item.description:
I’m at a bit of a loss to how I’m suppose to query these pids.

Description                      Display            PID           Min       Max       Scale       Unit       Equation
HV Battery state of charge       SoC                224801        0.0        100.0     x1          %           ((((A*256)+B)*(1/5))/100)
HV Battery temperature           HV Temp            224800        0.0        150.0     x1          DegF     ((A*18)-580)/100
HV Battery current in Amps       HV Amps            22480b       -200        200       x1          Amps     ((((Signed(A)*256)+B)/5)/10)*-1
HV Battery Voltage               HV Volts           22480d        0.0        400.0     x1          Volts       (((A*256)+B)/100)
Temperature inside car           Inside Temp        22dd04        0.0        160.0     x1          DegF     ((A*18)-400)/10

Read full topic
